title.rendered: Romanian Traditions in Motion Festival 2015 on 5-6th December

content.rendered:
In a week where the proud country of Romania celebrated its ‘Great Union Day’, Regent Group cordially invites you, your family and friends to celebrate and experience the Romanian Traditions in Motion festival this weekend, 5 & 6 December.
FREE ENTRY EVENTS
5 DECEMBER 2015 – 14.00-16.00 Debate ”Gogu Constantinescu- Romanian contribution to Science ”, Regent College Auditorium, 4-28 London Rd, Wembley, Middlesex HA9 7EX
6 DECEMBER 2015 – Patidar House Auditorium, 22 London Rd, Wembley, Middlesex HA9 7EX
4.00-19.00 Visual art exhibition by Sanda Voicu (painting), Ioan Astalus (scupture), Sorin Mihailescu & Vali Ciurea (photo).-Banquet Hall -FREE ENTRY
14.00-19.00 Book presentation -”What language will speak Romanians living abroad in 200 years”- Cosmin David, George Smarandache and Ionela Flood- Banquet Hall-FREE ENTRY
TICKETED EVENTS AVAILABLE ONLINE OR AT THE DOOR: “https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/romanian-tradition-in-motion-festival-ii-edition-london-2015-5-6-december-2015-regent-college-tickets-19656154086”
Please note that there are a small of complimentary tickets available for guests of Regent Group. Contact Matthew Gordon for details.
6 DECEMBER 2015 Patidar House Auditorium, 22 London Rd, Wembley, Middlesex HA9 7EX
14.00-15 .00 – ”Maria Tanase” – theatre play with Adriana Trandafir and George Smarandache- Auditorium
15.30-16.30 – Medieval Music show with Rapsodia Bucovinei-Auditorium
17.00-18.30 – Romanian Tradition in Motion Festival II edition 2015 – Folcloric show with Ioan Creteanu, Gusulei Gheorghina, Popescu Denisa, Ovidiu Svart and Rapsodia Bucovinei- Auditorium-Guests: AlexZ Children Choir-Ro Events
http://rapsodiabucovinei.ro/
http://romancasociety.blogspot.co.uk
Please contact Matthew Gordon – matthew.gordon@regentgroup.org.uk
for more information.
